metadata.titleEn: Geochemical data set of Paleozoic mafic intrusive rocks in Xilinhot area, Inner Mongolia, China
metadata.description: This data set includes the whole rock major and trace element geochemical data and zircon U-Pb isotope data of the Carboniferous Permian mafic intrusive rocks in Xilinhot area. The major element data of the whole rock are obtained by XRF, the trace element data of the whole rock are obtained by ICP-MS, and the zircon U-Pb isotope data are obtained by la-icp-ms. This set of data has been published in Acta  Geologica Sinica (English Edition), a geoscience SCI journal. Through the analysis of this set of data, the characteristics of magma source area and regional tectonic evolution history can be effectively constrained.
metadata.instructions: The data set is stored in Excel format, which can be directly opened and used by Excel workbooks. The major and trace data of the whole rock is named "2019 WR data", and the zircon U-Pb isotopic data is named "Zrn U-Pb isotope data".

literatureList.titleEn: Zircon U-Pb Ages and Geochemistry of Permo-Carboniferous Mafic Intrusions in the Xilinhot Area, Inner Mongolia: Constraints on the Northward Subduction of the Paleo-Asian Ocean.
literatureList.referenceEn:
Wang, K., Li, Y.L., Xiao, W.J., Zheng, J.P., Brouwer, F.M. (2019). Zircon U-Pb Ages and Geochemistry of Permo-Carboniferous Mafic Intrusions in the Xilinhot Area, Inner Mongolia: Constraints on the Northward Subduction of
the Paleo-Asian Ocean. Acta Geologica Sinica (English Edition), 93(05), 1261-1280.

Example.Question: Can you provide an example of a data collection method used to obtain geochemical data for Paleozoic mafic intrusions in Inner Mongolia, such as those from the Xilinhot area?
Example.Answer: A data collection method involves using X-ray fluorescence (XRF) to obtain whole-rock major element data, inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry (ICP-MS) for whole-rock trace element analysis, and laser ablation inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry (LA-ICP-MS) for zircon U-Pb isotopic data.

Feature Specification.Question: What are the characteristics of data collection methods used for geochemical analysis of Paleozoic mafic intrusions?
Feature Specification.Answer: XRF testing for whole-rock major element data, ICP-MS analysis for whole-rock trace element data, LA-ICP-MS testing for zircon U-Pb isotopic data

Quantification.Question: How many whole rock major element data samples are collected using XRF testing in a dataset related to magnesian intrusive rocks in the Xilinhot area, Inner Mongolia?
Quantification.Answer: The exact number of samples is not specified.

Definition.Question: What does '全岩主微量元素地球化学数据' mean in the context of geochemical datasets?
Definition.Answer: '全岩主微量元素地球化学数据' refers to the geochemical data of major and trace elements in whole rock samples, which are collected and analyzed to understand the composition and characteristics of geological materials. In the context of the dataset, these data are obtained using XRF for major elements and ICP-MS for trace elements.

Causal Antecedent.Question: What factors can influence the accuracy of geochemical data collection in studies of Paleozoic mafic intrusions in regions like Inner Mongolia's Xilinhot?
Causal Antecedent.Answer: The accuracy of geochemical data collection for Paleozoic mafic intrusions in regions such as Inner Mongolia's Xilinhot can be influenced by the choice of analytical methods, such as XRF for whole-rock major elements and ICP-MS for trace elements. The precision of zircon U-Pb isotopic data obtained using LA-ICP-MS could also be a factor, as well as the condition and representativeness of the rock samples collected. Additionally, environmental factors, equipment calibration, and the skill level of the technicians performing the analysis may also impact data accuracy.

Instrumental/Procedural.Question: What are the specific methods and instruments used to acquire geochemical and isotopic data from magmatic rocks in geological studies?
Instrumental/Procedural.Answer: In geological studies focusing on magmatic rocks, geochemical data, such as whole-rock major elements, are typically obtained using X-ray fluorescence (XRF) testing. Whole-rock trace element data are analyzed using inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry (ICP-MS). For isotopic data, such as zircon U-Pb isotopes, laser ablation inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry (LA-ICP-MS) is employed.
